MajorClaims.MC1: government should invest more on medical care and education rather than on entertaining or sports facilities
MajorClaims.MC2: budgets should be allocated more on medical care and education rather than on building entertaining facilities

Claims.C1: the former is more essential, non-profit oriented to the public and can be accessed by the majority of citizens
Claims.C2: providing education and medical care is more essential and prioritized to the government
Claims.C3: Entertaining facilities such as cinemas, theaters and sports stadiums are mostly profit-oriented
Claims.C4: sectors such as medical care and education deserve more governmental support

Premises.P1: Taking care of thousands of citizens who suffer from disease or illiteracy is more urgent and pragmatic than building theaters or sports stadiums
Premises.P2: an uneducated person may barely appreciate musicals, whereas a physical damaged person, resulting from the lack of medical treatment, may no longer participate in any sports games
Premises.P3: Their existences are based on their marketing strategies, the condition of facilities and the volume of audience
Premises.P4: The competition among each of these facilities is an inevitable part of the free market, which should not be interfered by government
Premises.P5: the establishment of medical facilities or educational institutes is aimed to improve the health or education standard rather than earning profits, which deserves more funds from government
Premises.P6: it is a bit inappropriate to use the majority of citizens' tax funds to meet a minority of people's needs
Premises.P7: they are accessed by every individual in our society on a daily basis
Premises.P8: putting taxpayers' money on building theaters or sports stadiums is unfair to those who cannot use them
Premises.P9: not everyone is a fan of watching musicals on the spot
